description.narrative:
The Project contributes to more democratic society and accountable and responsive state of Pakistan to close the tax gap and collect taxes fairly , reinforce pro-poor policies, de¬crease inequalities, and ultimately achieve marked advances in the progress towardsthe millennium development goals (MDGs).
This could be done by using tax revenues in a more transparent, accountable and redistributive way, allowing for an increase in public revenues through tax systems which effectively combat tax evasion,corruption and preventing the uncontrolled outflow of resources. Domestic tax revenues ensure sustainable funding of essential services for the poor, such as health and education. Fiscal autonomy is important - to be more resilient to face the consequences of the economic crisis . The establishment of accountable, fair and pro poor tax system could significantly improve the lives of the poor, decrease inequalities and fund part of the delivery of the MDGs. More and better aid or debt cancellations alone,although crucially essential too, are not sufficient to ensure universal, quality and sustainable essential services in the South, as they are by no means sustainable or politically viable in the mid-term. Alternative internal sources of revenue need to be developed. Sustainable finance should not be dependent on aid for the long-term. Generating national resources, or rather preventing the large uncontrolled outflow of resources and combating corruption and tax evasion, in principle is the right policy direction. However, the burden of domestic revenue mobilization should not fall dispro¬por¬tionately on the poor, as a matter of justice. As such, it is essential that national tax systems provide for appropriate levels of direct taxes, such as those thatmay be derived from progressive corporate and personal income taxes, from land/property and from non-tax revenuessuch as those from extractives industries and that excessive and discretionary tax exemptions be avoided. Such policies would not only allow for additional resources, but would also reinforce the legitimacy of public administrations in the eyes of their citizens. This requires strong legal commitment, as well as a deep insight in the legal manipulations and gaps that allow tax dodging, particularly for local elites and international companies, and in the dynamics behind the thriving corruption and tax evasion.

participating-org.narrative:
Indus Consortium - a collaborative platform of 3 humanitarian and development organizations i.e. Laar Humanitarian Development Program (LHDP), Doaba Foundation and HELP Foundation - is a manifestation of a joint force of the people living around Sindhu (Indus) River basin in Pakistan. The consortium represents the unity among various groups of different ethnic, linguistic and geographic features and their resolve to struggle for the development of the people around Indus River basin whose forefathers, in the ancient ages, had developed one of the most prosperous civilizations around the globe; remembered in history as Indus Civilization.
Indus Consortium envisions a democratic and equitable society where all citizens enjoy equal economic, cultural and political rights. Our mission is to works for local communities to enhance their resilience and participation in development.
